item.title: [REL] Sword of fear [REL]
item.dc:creator: @Pluvia Pluvia
item.description:
@Pluvia wrote:

[quote=“mongoth666, post:29, topic:366476”]No offence but clearly some of you don’t read the entire thread

I said i didn’t try my best with this, and i said it’ll make a great 2H since i scaled the top part a bit to long.

I really don’t know why i’m getting spammed with “unnecessary polygons/doesn’t need that many polys” Because i already explained before -.-[/quote]
Nah bro I read your entire thread I agreed with you with the whole “would look great as a 2h.” thing. (Why I tried it out as a 2h in the first place) Use my pic or pics in your topic to show what it looks like as a 2h. It is the same size as a SS. So don’t worry about the height.

Read full topic

item.title: [REL] Sword of fear [REL]
item.dc:creator: @Pluvia Pluvia
item.description:
@Pluvia wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:25, topic:366476”]do i need to change the model itself to make it 2H and then add nr to 2H.dat???
or just add to 2H.dat???

btw looks awesome :D[/quote]
In your weapon ints (source) Just insted of adding them in the 1h things add them to the 2h ones. Mine was in the client.Java because I like to use delta. Add it to the same places as your God Swords.

item.title: [REL] Sword of fear [REL]
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

blk joe12:

Doesn’t matter if it’s a trace or not to me, I like it. Good Job and Gl with future models.

Definately matters if it’s a trace.
I’m not going to stop saying it’s a trace because making half a model out lines extruded upwards and mirror is considered tracing.

Read full topic

item.title: [REL] Sword of fear [REL]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

@reyx7 wasn’t talking to you

@mongoth : tracing is when you use the lines tool and create a base and then use the face tool to create faces. Take much more time than primitive modeling, but both are equally effective. Just primitive modeling is quicker. When tracing try and make it even. If you need any help on tips for tracing just search my guide. Just searched advanced in the model section and it’ll be up there.

Read full topic

item.title: [REL] Sword of fear [REL]
item.dc:creator: @mongoth666 mongoth666
item.description:
@mongoth666 wrote:

mk then, what exactly do you guys mean by trace then?

I thought you guys we’re saying i just made wireframes, colored it, and extruding it giving it no detail.

They way i modeled this is by selecting points and lines and moving them upward to give it detail. Then once i finished doing that, i mirrored the whole thing.

Read full topic

It is traced. Try reading my text better.

item.title: [REL] Sword of fear [REL]
item.dc:creator: @mongoth666 mongoth666
item.description:
@mongoth666 wrote:

Simple… just move both rar files into your 317 client that says “models” and put them in there.

Put those ints in “class8.java” compile, run client.

when ingame type “add model 9111”

Once thats done type “add model 9110” (dont add “::” infront of it)

shrogg:

I agree with paymon, people are getting better, and you are a good example of that, the sword looks fine, but i think you could drastically remove some of the faces in the hilt, and just make each segment a triangle, and you will get the same effect.

Would kill the poly limit. Was already high when i imported it. I didnt try my best on this model. Sorry

Read full topic
